ggsegBrainnetome 0.0.1
  • Reference

ggsegBrainnetome

This package contains dataset for plotting the Brainnetome atlas ggseg and ggseg3d.

Yu C, Zhou Y, Liu Y, Jiang T, Dong H, Zhang Y, Walter M. Functional segregation of the human cingulate cortex is confirmed by functional connectivity based neuroanatomical parcellation. Neuroimage. 2011 Feb 14;54(4):2571-81. doi: 10.1016/j.neuroimage.2010.11.018. Epub 2010 Nov

  1. PMID: 21073967. pubmed.

To learn how to use these atlases, please look at the documentation for ggseg and ggseg3d

Installation

We recommend installing the ggseg-atlases through the ggseg r-universe:

# Enable this universe
options(repos = c(
    ggseg = 'https://ggseg.r-universe.dev',
    CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))

# Install some packages
install.packages('ggsegBrainnetome')

You can install the released version of ggsegBrainnetome from GitHub with:

# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("LCBC-UiO/ggsegBrainnetome")
library(ggseg)
#> Loading required package: ggplot2
library(ggseg3d)
library(ggsegBrainnetome)

plot(brainnetome) +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom", 
        legend.text = element_text(size = 9)) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(ncol = 6))

library(dplyr)
ggseg3d(atlas = brainnetome_3d) %>% 
  add_glassbrain() %>% 
  pan_camera("right lateral")
